pullRequest.body:
We add some results on invertible matrices, showing that for a finite square matrix `A`, `IsUnit A` is equivalent to the surjectivity/injectivity of left/right multiplication, and to the linear independence of the set of rows/columns. 

We also add a couple of lemmas about the existence of left/right inverses for nonsquare matrices, and a bit of API for `mulVecLin` and `vecMulLinear`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

bors merge

Thanks, and sorry for letting this fall off my radar

bors merge

Thanks, and sorry for letting this fall off my radar

```suggestion
  simp_rw [← mulVec_transpose, mulVec_surjective_iff_exists_rightInverse]
  refine ⟨fun ⟨B, hB⟩ ↦ ⟨Bᵀ, ?_⟩, fun ⟨B, hB⟩ ↦ ⟨Bᵀ, by rw [← transpose_mul, hB, transpose_one]⟩⟩
```

```suggestion
  rw [← isUnit_transpose, ← vecMul_surjective_iff_isUnit]; convert Iff.rfl; rw [vecMul_transpose]
```

```suggestion
  · rw [← isUnit_transpose, ← vecMul_surjective_iff_isUnit]
```

```suggestion
  rw [← transpose_transpose A, isUnit_transpose, linearIndependent_rows_iff_isUnit,
```

```suggestion
  rw [← transpose_transpose A, ← mulVecLin_injective_iff, mulVecLin_transpose,
```

```suggestion
  simp_rw [← mulVec_transpose, mulVec_injective_iff_isUnit, isUnit_transpose]
```

```suggestion
  rw [← vecMulLinear_transpose, range_vecMulLinear]
```

```suggestion
  rw [← LinearMap.ker_eq_bot, LinearMap.ker_eq_bot']
```
Is there a style guide reference for having the space after the arrow?
And if it's part of the official style, why doesn't the linter enforce it?
https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.238178.20space.20after.20.E2.86.90
Generally `Invertible` should only be used when you are actually using the data of the `invOf` operator. Here you're not, so `IsUnit` would be more appropriate.
These lemmas are analogous to `mul_right_injective_of_invertible` etc in the section above. What makes them different?
Ugh, you're right. Sounds like a future cleanup task for me, rather than a reasonable request on this PR.

I think probably we should just remove the `simps` so that this can get the unpriemd name. You also shouldn't need to redeclare the variables
```suggestion
@[simp] theorem Matrix.vecMulLinear_apply [Fintype m] (M : Matrix m n R) (x : m → R) :
  M.vecMulLinear x = M.vecMul x := rfl
```

```suggestion
theorem range_vecMulLinear {R m n : Type*} [CommSemiring R] [Fintype m] (M : Matrix m n R) :
```
though it would be better to re-use the existing variables.

I think it might be a little cleaner to prove 
```suggestion
    (∃ B : Matrix n m α, B * A = 1) ↔ IsUnit A := by
```
which could go right next to `isUnit_of_left_inverse`.
After my golf, this proof now works on semirings (dropping both `-` and commutativity); can you try to generalize some of the other results in the same way?
I think this one should hold for division rings? Note that since you have `h`, you don't need `A⁻¹`, and can use `invOf` (`\frac1`) instead, which removes the commutativity assumption.

I'm not sure about the forwards direction - you can get to the existence of a left inverse from injectivity, but the lemma that gets you from there to `IsUnit A` requires `CommRing`. Is it true that left-invertibility implies right-invertibility for matrices over noncommutative rings?
Ah you're right, of course it doesn't; you need only consider 1x1 matrices to see why.
Perhaps this is evidence that these should be a separate lemma for existence of a left-inverse.
Perhaps - this feels like scope creep for this PR, though.
Fair
For me, the fact that unneeded `Fintype`s are scattered around the matrix API is more of a pressing problem than the commutativity assumptions. But that's for another day as well.

To make it clear that you already did the work for this proof earlier, rather than proving it from scratch again:
```suggestion
theorem vecMul_surjective_of_invertible (A : Matrix m m α) [Invertible A] :
    Function.Surjective A.vecMul :=
  vecMul_surjective_iff_isUnit.2 <| isUnit_of_invertible A

theorem mulVec_surjective_of_invertible (A : Matrix m m α) [Invertible A] :
    Function.Surjective A.mulVec :=
  mulVec_surjective_iff_isUnit.2 <| isUnit_of_invertible A
```
(this matches the following four proofs anyway)

I think this should be stated as:
```suggestion
    Function.Injective M.vecMul ↔ LinearIndependent R (fun i ↦ M i) := by
```
since `vecMulLinear` is being coerced to a function in this statement anyway.
You can repair the proof with  `← Matrix.coe_vecMulLinear` on the first line.

Same below for `mulVecLin_injective_iff`
(in general, if we have a family of bundled functions, we only state injectivity for the raw function)
Nice catch!

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [mul_apply_eq_vecMul, one_eq_pi_single, ← hrows] ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion transpose_transpose, ← vecMul_injective_iff_isUnit, coe_vecMulLinear] ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [← h0] ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [← h0] ```
